review.title: “Fast Paced Company. Growing fast every year.”
review.pros: Pros – Hard working good associates to work with. Not many people will you find not working hard. Real team effort.
review.cons: Cons – Questionable executive leadership decisions. Salaries are inconsistent vs employee value add to the company.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Focus on what I-Cubed is good at. 401k matching is important. Hold senior management to the same standard as all other employees.

review.title: “Senior management very poor at leading and managing subordinates”
review.pros: Pros – The people other than senior management.
review.cons: Cons – Conflicting guidance from senior management.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be open to the capabilities of the people you hire and trust them to grow into the job. Excessive control and micro-management stifles creative and capable people.

review.title: “Great place for recent graduates to break into PLM and PTC products related services industry.”
review.pros: Pros – Good place for younger talent to get started, exposed to a wide variety of engineering & manufacturing information technology. Great place for hungry minds to explore a broad array of tools and technologies.
review.cons: Cons – Business model built around proximity to NC State College, i.e. easy access to young talented developers with salary expectations well below industry average.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Drop the Six Thinking Hats- demeaning for naturally critical thinkers.

review.title: “Nice Work Environment”
review.pros: Pros – - Nice employees and facility- Decent company culture, fun events- Free snacks and drinks- Laid back work environment with casual dress code- Open office space that encourages employee interaction- Opportunities for recent grads
review.cons: Cons – - Little room for growth if you are not a consultant or developer- Management not as open and friendly as they appear to be- Company does not seem to be poised for growth. It will mostly likely stay a small start-up company forever- Poor workforce planning

review.title: “Best company I have ever worked for!”
review.pros: Pros – My hard work is valued and appreciated by peers and managementThe CEO is open minded, down to earth and encourages open and honest communicationCollaboration is highly valued, individuals are not fighting to climb the corporate ladder but rather working to grow the company as a team.
review.cons: Cons – If you are looking for a place to coast I-Cubed is not for you. Otherwise it's an amazing place to work
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep doing what you're doing!

review.title: “They have a lot to work on”
review.pros: Pros – casual work environment and relatively flexible on when you come/leave until they start scheduling meetings every morning from 8-8:30a and from 5:30-6p. This seems to only be the case for Operations and Business Development. Great location of an office (close to highway). Free parking.
review.cons: Cons – Intimidating and unapproachable executive team. They talk down to you and it wasn't just to me, I would see people being called out in our group meetings. They have a young business development/sales team and it definitely showed.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Relax. The CEO seems very nice and friendly at first but get in a meeting with him or ask for his "help" and he makes you feel like you are inferior to the world. I'm not suggesting he should be a push over but realize that intimidation isn't going to keep employees. I have though, heard that outside of Operations and Business Development (ie the technical team) I-Cubed is a much more enjoyable place.
